Introduction to the Web-enabled Landsat Data (WELD) products using open source software

The NASA funded Web-enabled Landsat Data (WELD) project is systematically generating 30m composited Landsat Enhanced Thematic Mapper Plus (ETM+) mosaics of the conterminous United States and Alaska from 2002 to 2012.
The WELD products provide the first instance of continental-scale science-quality Landsat data with a level of pre-processing comparable to the NASA MODIS land products.

  • WELD overview - How to get data
  • Data visualization using openev
  • Manipulation and visualization of WELD single pixel time series
  • Change Detection, Classification, Segmentation - WELD burned area mapping
  • Comparison of TOA vs SR
